segments.text: I see the woman so concentrated on her task, drying the plate with great care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her focus is admirable, yet I can't help but feel surprised that she hasn’t noticed the overflowing sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water spills over, creating a little waterfall that cascades down the cabinet doors.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it will take her to realize that the floor is becoming a hazardous swamp.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, stretching way too far to reach those cookies in the jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His little body wobbles dangerously, making me hold my breath in anticipation of a fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And there’s the girl, standing there with her palm open, her expression filled with expectation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost comical how oblivious the woman is, while the children play their risky game behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about how the quiet garden outside contrasts with the chaos inside, yet it feels so ordinary.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Is this what domestic life is like? A blend of calm moments interrupted by impending disaster?
segments.speaker: PAR
